Templates.Description: Solution template for creating a multi-platform C# & XAML application targeting Windows App SDK, Android, iOS, macOS, WebAssembly, Skia/WPF and Skia/GTK for Linux.

recommended.Description: Recommended set of options to create a production-ready app targeting multiple platforms

blank.Description: Smallest set of options, with no extra dependencies, to create an app targeting multiple platforms

Parameters.Name: tfm
Parameters.Description: Select the .NET version of your solution

Parameters.Name: architecture
Parameters.Description: Select the design pattern for your application

mvux.Description: Use the Model-View-Update eXtended (MVUX) design pattern

Parameters.Name: markup
Parameters.Description: How would you like to code your UI

Parameters.Name: appTheme
Parameters.Description: Selects the theme design system for the application.

Parameters.Name: platforms
Parameters.Description: What platforms would you like to target

unit.Description: Include a project for authoring traditional unit tests

ui.Description: Include a project for authoring UI tests using the Uno.UITest framework

Parameters.Name: server
Parameters.Description: Includes a Server project for an API & host for the WebAssembly project

Parameters.Name: dependencyInjection
Parameters.Description: Use dependency injection for registering and accessing services

Parameters.Name: http
Parameters.Description: Register native handlers for http and setup Refit support

Parameters.Name: localization
Parameters.Description: Configures support for localizing resources throughout the application

Parameters.Name: logging
Parameters.Description: Configures logging support in the application

none.Description: Debug Logging for the Application Framework to the Console

default.Description: Logging is accessible via dependency injection and writes output to Console

serilog.Description: Logging is accessible via dependency injection and configured to use Serilog

regions.Description: Uses Uno.Extensions.Navigation to navigate using regions

blank.Description: Provides Blank App experience with default WinUI Frame Navigation

Parameters.Name: cpm
Parameters.Description: Use Central Package Management where package versions are via central Directory.Packages.props file

Parameters.Name: vscode
Parameters.Description: Sets up Visual Studio Code Debugging for WebAssembly and Skia Gtk

Parameters.Name: wasmPwaManifest
Parameters.Description: Includes a manifest in the WebAssembly project to make the application a PWA

Parameters.Name: skipRestore
Parameters.Description: If specified, skips the automatic restore of the project on create.

TemplatePackages.Name: fake-template
TemplatePackages.Description: Package Description

tool.Description: Uses the FAKE dotnet sdk global tool to bootstrap FAKE. The tool is installed into 'tool--path'

local.Description: Uses the FAKE dotnet sdk local tool to bootstrap FAKE. The tool is installed into the sdk tool manifest

none.Description: Does not bootstrap FAKE. Use this if you want to use a global installation of FAKE

file.Description: Use paket.dependencies file to define build dependencies

inline.Description: Define build dependencies inside the build script

none.Description: No dependencies are created. Use this if you already have a paket.dependencies file in your folder

fake.Description: Uses the default FAKE domain specific language (see https://fake.build/guide/core-targets.html)

buildtask.Description: Uses a string free domain specific language, called [BuildTask](https://github.com/vbfox/FoxSharp/blob/master/src/BlackFox.Fake.BuildTask/Readme.md)

Parameters.Name: tool-path
Parameters.Description: Folder for the FAKE dotnet sdk global tool. This parameter is only applicable when 'tool' is used for bootstrapping

Parameters.Name: version
Parameters.Description: Version of FAKE to install. This parameter is only applicable when either 'local' or 'tool' is used for bootstrapping

Templates.Name: Blazor Server App (Microsoft identity platform)
Templates.Author: Microsoft
Templates.Description: A project template for creating a Blazor server app that runs server-side inside an ASP.NET Core app and handles user interactions over a SignalR connection. This template can be used for web apps with rich dynamic user interfaces (UIs).

Parameters.Name: auth
Parameters.Description: The type of authentication to use

IndividualB2C.Description: Individual authentication with Azure AD B2C

SingleOrg.Description: Organizational authentication for a single tenant

Parameters.Name: AAdB2CInstance
Parameters.Description: The Azure Active Directory B2C instance to connect to (use with IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: SignUpSignInPolicyId
Parameters.Description: The sign-in and sign-up policy ID for this project (use with IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: SignedOutCallbackPath
Parameters.Description: The global signout callback (use with IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: ResetPasswordPolicyId
Parameters.Description: The reset password policy ID for this project (use with IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: EditProfilePolicyId
Parameters.Description: The edit profile policy ID for this project (use with IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: AADInstance
Parameters.Description: The Azure Active Directory instance to connect to (use with SingleOrg or MultiOrg auth).

Parameters.Name: ClientId
Parameters.Description: The Client ID for this project (use with IndividualB2C, SingleOrg or MultiOrg auth).

Parameters.Name: Domain
Parameters.Description: The domain for the directory tenant (use with SingleOrg or IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: TenantId
Parameters.Description: The TenantId ID of the directory to connect to (use with SingleOrg auth).

Parameters.Name: CallbackPath
Parameters.Description: The request path within the application's base path of the redirect URI (use with SingleOrg or IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: OrgReadAccess
Parameters.Description: Whether or not to allow this application read access to the directory (only applies to SingleOrg or MultiOrg auth).

Parameters.Name: UserSecretsId
Parameters.Description: The ID to use for secrets (use with OrgReadAccess or Individual auth).

Parameters.Name: ExcludeLaunchSettings
Parameters.Description: Whether to exclude launchSettings.json from the generated template.

Parameters.Name: HttpPort
Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the HTTP endpoint in launchSettings.json.

Parameters.Name: HttpsPort
Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the HTTPS endpoint in launchSettings.json. This option is only applicable when the parameter no-https is not used (no-https will be ignored if either IndividualAuth or OrganizationalAuth is used).

Parameters.Name: NoHttps
Parameters.Description: Whether to turn off HTTPS. This option only applies if Individual, IndividualB2C, SingleOrg, or MultiOrg aren't used for --auth.

Parameters.Name: UseLocalDB
Parameters.Description: Whether to use LocalDB instead of SQLite. This option only applies if --auth Individual or --auth IndividualB2C is specified.

Parameters.Name: Framework
Parameters.Description: The target framework for the project.

Parameters.Name: CalledApiUrl
Parameters.Description: URL of the API to call from the web app. This option only applies if --auth SingleOrg, --auth MultiOrg or --auth IndividualB2C is specified.

Parameters.Name: CallsMicrosoftGraph
Parameters.Description: Specifies if the web app calls Microsoft Graph. This option only applies if --auth SingleOrg or --auth MultiOrg is specified.

Parameters.Name: CalledApiScopes
Parameters.Description: Scopes to request to call the API from the web app. This option only applies if --auth SingleOrg, --auth MultiOrg or --auth IndividualB2C is specified.

Parameters.Name: skipRestore
Parameters.Description: If specified, skips the automatic restore of the project on create.

Templates.Name: Blazor WebAssembly App
Templates.Author: Microsoft
Templates.Description: A project template for creating a Blazor app that runs on WebAssembly and is optionally hosted by an ASP.NET Core app. This template can be used for web apps with rich dynamic user interfaces (UIs).

Parameters.Name: Framework
Parameters.Description: The target framework for the project.

Parameters.Name: skipRestore
Parameters.Description: If specified, skips the automatic restore of the project on create.

Parameters.Name: Hosted
Parameters.Description: If specified, includes an ASP.NET Core host for the Blazor WebAssembly app.

Parameters.Name: auth
Parameters.Description: The type of authentication to use

IndividualB2C.Description: Individual authentication with Azure AD B2C

SingleOrg.Description: Organizational authentication for a single tenant

Parameters.Name: Authority
Parameters.Description: The authority of the OIDC provider (use with standalone Individual auth).

Parameters.Name: AAdB2CInstance
Parameters.Description: The Azure Active Directory B2C instance to connect to (use with IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: SignUpSignInPolicyId
Parameters.Description: The sign-in and sign-up policy ID for this project (use with IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: AADInstance
Parameters.Description: The Azure Active Directory instance to connect to (use with SingleOrg auth).

Parameters.Name: ClientId
Parameters.Description: The Client ID for this project (use with IndividualB2C, SingleOrg or Individual auth in standalone scenarios).

Parameters.Name: Domain
Parameters.Description: The domain for the directory tenant (use with SingleOrg or IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: AppIDUri
Parameters.Description: The App ID Uri for the server API we want to call (use with SingleOrg or IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: APIClientId
Parameters.Description: The Client ID for the API that the server hosts (use with IndividualB2C, SingleOrg).

Parameters.Name: DefaultScope
Parameters.Description: The API scope the client needs to request to provision an access token. (use with IndividualB2C, SingleOrg).

Parameters.Name: TenantId
Parameters.Description: The TenantId ID of the directory to connect to (use with SingleOrg auth).

Parameters.Name: OrgReadAccess
Parameters.Description: Whether or not to allow this application read access to the directory (only applies to SingleOrg).

Parameters.Name: UserSecretsId
Parameters.Description: The ID to use for secrets (use with OrgReadAccess or Individual auth).

Parameters.Name: ExcludeLaunchSettings
Parameters.Description: Whether to exclude launchSettings.json from the generated template.

Parameters.Name: HttpPort
Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the HTTP endpoint in launchSettings.json.

Parameters.Name: HttpsPort
Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the HTTPS endpoint in launchSettings.json. This option is only applicable when the parameter no-https is not used (no-https will be ignored if either IndividualAuth or OrganizationalAuth is used).

Parameters.Name: PWA
Parameters.Description: If specified, produces a Progressive Web Application (PWA) supporting installation and offline use.

Parameters.Name: NoHttps
Parameters.Description: Whether to turn off HTTPS. This option only applies if Individual, IndividualB2C, SingleOrg, or MultiOrg aren't used for --auth.

Parameters.Name: UseLocalDB
Parameters.Description: Whether to use LocalDB instead of SQLite. This option only applies if --auth Individual or --auth IndividualB2C is specified.

Parameters.Name: CalledApiUrl
Parameters.Description: URL of the API to call from the web app. This option only applies if --auth SingleOrg, --auth MultiOrg or --auth IndividualB2C without and ASP.NET Core host is specified.

Parameters.Name: CallsMicrosoftGraph
Parameters.Description: Specifies if the web app calls Microsoft Graph. This option only applies if --auth SingleOrg or --auth MultiOrg is specified.

Parameters.Name: CalledApiScopes
Parameters.Description: Scopes to request to call the API from the web app. This option only applies if --auth SingleOrg, --auth MultiOrg or --auth IndividualB2C without and ASP.NET Core host is specified.

Parameters.Name: Title
Parameters.Description: The name of the project which determines the assembly product name. If the Swagger feature is enabled, shows the title on the Swagger UI.

Parameters.Name: Description
Parameters.Description: A description of the project which determines the assembly description. If the Swagger feature is enabled, shows the description on the Swagger UI.

Parameters.Name: Author
Parameters.Description: The name of the author of the project which determines the assembly author, company and copyright information.

Parameters.Name: Swagger
Parameters.Description: Swagger is a format for describing the endpoints in your API. Swashbuckle is used to generate a Swagger document and to generate beautiful API documentation, including a UI to explore and test operations, directly from your routes, controllers and models.

Parameters.Name: Versioning
Parameters.Description: Enable API versioning to version API endpoints. The version can be specified in the URL query parameter (This is the default e.g. /api/foo?api-version=1.0), URL (e.g. /api/v1/foo), HTTP header (e.g. api-version: 1.0) or a custom MIME type (e.g. application/vnd.mycompany.myapp-v2+xml).

Parameters.Name: LoadBalancer
Parameters.Description: If you use a load balancer, updates the request scheme using the X-Forwarded-Proto HTTP header.

Parameters.Name: ReverseProxyWebServer
Parameters.Description: The internet facing reverse proxy web server you want to use in front of the primary web server to host the site.

Internet Information Services (IIS).Description: A flexible, secure and manageable Web server for hosting anything on the Web using Windows Server. Select this option if you are deploying your site to Azure web apps. IIS is preconfigured to set request limits for security.

NGINX.Description: A free, open-source, cross-platform high-performance HTTP server and reverse proxy, as well as an IMAP/POP3 proxy server. It does have a Windows version but it's not very fast and IIS is better on that platform. If the HTTPS Everywhere feature is enabled, NGINX is pre-configured to enable the most secure TLS protocols and ciphers for security and to enable HTTP 2.0 and SSL stapling for performance.

Both.Description: Support both reverse proxy web servers.

Parameters.Name: CloudProvider
Parameters.Description: Select which cloud provider you are using if any, to add cloud specific features.

Azure.Description: The Microsoft Azure cloud. Adds logging features that let you see logs in the Azure portal.

None.Description: No cloud provider is being used.

Parameters.Name: Analytics
Parameters.Description: Monitor internal information about how your application is running, as well as external user information.

Application Insights.Description: Monitor internal information about how your application is running, as well as external user information using the Microsoft Azure cloud.

Parameters.Name: ApplicationInsightsKey
Parameters.Description: Your Application Insights instrumentation key e.g. 11111111-2222-3333-4444-555555555555.

Parameters.Name: HttpsEverywhere
Parameters.Description: Use the HTTPS scheme and TLS security across the entire site, redirects HTTP to HTTPS and adds a Strict Transport Security (HSTS) HTTP header with preloading enabled. Configures the primary and reverse proxy web servers for best security and adds a development certificate file for use in your development environment.

Parameters.Name: CORS
Parameters.Description: Browser security prevents a web page from making AJAX requests to another domain. This restriction is called the same-origin policy, and prevents a malicious site from reading sensitive data from another site. CORS is a W3C standard that allows a server to relax the same-origin policy. Using CORS, a server can explicitly allow some cross-origin requests while rejecting others.

Parameters.Name: ResponseCaching
Parameters.Description: Response caching is allows the use of the [ResponseCache] attribute on your action methods. Cache settings (cache profiles) are stored in the configuration file and referred to by name.

Parameters.Name: XmlFormatter
Parameters.Description: Choose whether to use the XML input/output formatter and which serializer to use.

DataContractSerializer.Description: The default XML serializer you should use. Requires the use of [DataContract] and [DataMember] attributes.

XmlSerializer.Description: The alternative XML serializer which is slower but gives more control. Uses the [XmlRoot], [XmlElement] and [XmlAttribute] attributes.

Parameters.Name: HealthCheck
Parameters.Description: A health-check endpoint that returns the status of this API and it's dependencies, giving an indication of it's health. This endpoint can be called by site monitoring tools which ping the site or by load balancers which can remove an instance of this API if it is not functioning correctly.

Parameters.Name: RequestId
Parameters.Description: Require that all requests send the X-Request-ID HTTP header containing a GUID. This is useful where you have access to the client and server logs and want to correlate a request and response between the two.

Parameters.Name: UserAgent
Parameters.Description: Require that all requests send the User-Agent HTTP header containing the application name and version of the caller.

Parameters.Name: RobotsTxt
Parameters.Description: Adds a robots.txt file to tell search engines not to index this site.

Parameters.Name: HumansTxt
Parameters.Description: Adds a humans.txt file where you can tell the world who wrote the application. This file is a good place to thank your developers.

Parameters.Name: SkipRestore
Parameters.Description: Skips the execution of 'dotnet restore' on project creation.

Parameters.Description: Skips the opening of the projects Read-Me in a web browser.

TemplatePackages.Name: Softlion.NotionSharp.TemplateProjects
TemplatePackages.Description:
Install the template (it will download from nuget automatically):
      > dotnet new -i Softlion.NotionSharp.TemplateProjects
      
      Get help on parameters for this template:
      > dotnet new blazorblog --help
      
      -p|--page       Title of a page on Notion which contains all the pages of the blog
                      string - Required

      -k|--key        value of the notion tokenV2 cookie
                      string - Optional
                      Default: __YourNotionKey__

      -b|--browserId  value of the notion browserId cookie
                      Guid - Optional
                      Default: __YourNotionBrowserId__

      -us|--userId    value of the notion userId cookie
                      Guid - Optional
                      Default: __YourNotionUserId__
      
      Create a new website in the current folder, using this template:
      > dotnet new blazorblog --page "My Public Blog" --key xxXxxXXxxXxxxXXxxx...xxXxxX --browserId aabbccdd-aabb-aabb-aabb-aabbccddaabb --userId eeffeeff-eeff-eeff-eeff-eeffeeffeeff
      
      You can also use this simple command:
      > dotnet new blazorblog --page "My Public Blog"
      
      But if you do so, you should add the values as user secrets (remember that secrets work in debug mode only):
      > dotnet user-secrets init
      > dotnet user-secrets set "Notion:Key" "xxXxxXXxxXxxxXXxxx...xxXxxX"
      > dotnet user-secrets set "Notion:BrowserId" "aabbccdd-aabb-aabb-aabb-aabbccddaabb"
      > dotnet user-secrets set "Notion:UserId" "eeffeeff-eeff-eeff-eeff-eeffeeffeeff"
      > dotnet user-secrets set "Notion:CmsPageTitle" "Public blog"
  
      To uninstall this template:
      > dotnet new -u Softlion.NotionSharp.TemplateProject.Blog
      
      To list all installed templates and get uninstall instructions:
      > dotnet new --uninstall --help

      To build a docker image of the blazor blog and test it:
      right clic the project, clic Publish then choose Docker.
      Or use these commands:
      > docker build -t yourdockerhub.com/demonotionblog:1.0.0 .
      > docker run -p8080:5000 yourdockerhub.com/demonotionblog:1.0.0
      > start http://localhost:8080/
      Don't forget to set up your notion keys in appsettings.Production.json before, as user secrets are not used in Release mode.
      Note: the prebuilt docker image vapolia/demonotionblog:latest is made for helm and is missing the appsettings-secrets.Production.json file.

      To push the blog to a kubernetes cluster:
      > helm upgrade demonotionblog helm\notionsharpblog --install -f your-value.yaml --dry-run
      > start http://localhost:5080/
      Check helm\notionsharpblog\values.yaml for the available values.

      Example of a simple your-values.yaml file suitable for minikube:

          appSettingsSecrets:
            appsettings-secrets.Production.json: |-
              {
                "Notion": {
                  "Key": "aabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccddaabbccdd",
                  "BrowserId": "aabbccdd-aabb-aabb-aabb-aabbccddaabb",
                  "UserId": "eeffeeff-eeff-eeff-eeff-eeffeeffeeff",
                  "CmsPageTitle": "My Blog"
                }
              }

          #For minikube only
          service:
            type: LoadBalancer
            port: 5080

Parameters.Name: page
Parameters.Description: Title of a page on Notion which contains all the pages of the blog

Parameters.Name: key
Parameters.Description: value of the notion tokenV2 cookie

Parameters.Name: browserId
Parameters.Description: value of the notion browserId cookie

Parameters.Name: userId
Parameters.Description: value of the notion userId cookie

TemplatePackages.Name: actionETL.templates.dotnet
TemplatePackages.Description:
C# dotnet templates for creating ETL applications with actionETL.
    
- "actionetl.console" template creates an actionETL console project
- "actionetl.addtoproject" template adds actionETL to an existing project

Please see https://docs.envobi.com/actionetl/articles/dotnet-templates.html for details.

actionETL is a cross-platform ETL library for easily writing high performance, highly productive ETL data processing applications in C#, VB, etc. running on Windows and Linux. Well-suited to both small and truly large and complex projects.

- Community: Get your FREE license at https://envobi.com/community-edition
- Trial: Evaluate the commercial versions at https://envobi.com/trial
- Commercial: View and purchase the product at https://envobi.com

Supported platforms:

- .NET Framework 4.6.1+
- .NET Standard 2.0+
- .NET Core 2.1+ (via .NET Standard 2.0)
- .NET 5+ (via .NET Standard 2.0)
- Windows and Linux
- On-premises and cloud

Features:

- Extensive dataflow and control flow capabilities
- MariaDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLite, and SQL Server targeted database providers
- ODBC database provider for other databases
- High performance bulk insert
- Spreadsheet, delimited, fixed format, etc.
- Use nuget.org to easily retrieve new versions of actionETL

and much more, see https://envobi.com for details.

Parameters.Name: Framework
Parameters.Description: The target framework for the project.

TemplatePackages.Name: LogicMonitor.Cli
TemplatePackages.Description:
Creates a template LogicMonitor project for .NET 7.0.

To install (or update) the template, type:

	dotnet new install LogicMonitor.Cli

If you do not specify the namespace with --name, the folder name is used instead

Once installed, go to an empty folder and type:

	dotnet new logicmonitor [--name Project.Namespace]

Then modify the appsettings.json file to include your LogicMonitor account, Access Id and Access Key.  After this, build and run with:

	dotnet run

This should provide some basic information about your LogicMonitor account to demonstrate a working project.

Parameters.Name: skipRestore
Parameters.Description: If specified, skips the automatic restore of the project on create.

TemplatePackages.Description:
This is a project template for .Net Core 3.1 API,
    pre-configured and ready to use with, 
    1. Autofac 5.2.0 registrations setup.
    2. Ready Swagger 5.5.1 endpoint. 
    3. pre-Configured Serilog 2.9.0 console sinks.
    4. pre-Configured AutoMapper 10.0.0.
    5. pre-Installed Newtonsoft.Json 12.0.3
    6. pre-Setup NUnit Tests
    7. pre-Setup AutoFixture with Moq
    8. pre-Setup FluentAssertions
    using `dotnet new -i Superwalnut.NetCoreApiTemplate` to install project as a template,
    And using `dotnet new core-api-autofac-swagger-serilog` to create a project with the template.

TemplatePackages.Name: grpcpi
TemplatePackages.Description:
gRPC Template configured for a RaspberryPi Client.  
		Includes a nuget reference to ARM32 compiled native library (libgrpc_csharp_ext v1.1.0) necessary for gRPC to work on the pi, and quick scripts for publishing and deploying to your pi.  It demonstrates both client/server communication using gRPC and gpio using System.Device.Gpio (v1.0) on a pi client based on the response from the server. Includes an implementation of GpioDriver which called ConsoleDriver which outputs pin commands to the console for local debugging and testing

Templates.Name: Basic client/server solution for gRPC on RaspberryPi

Parameters.Description: Browser security prevents a web page from making AJAX requests to another domain. CORS is a W3C standard that allows a server to relax the same-origin policy. Using CORS, a server can explicitly allow some cross-origin requests while rejecting others.

TemplatePackages.Name: Meraki.Cli
TemplatePackages.Description:
Creates a template Meraki project for .NET 7.0.

			To install (or update) the template, type:

			dotnet new install Meraki.Cli

			Once installed, go to an empty folder and type:

			dotnet new meraki [--name Project.Namespace] [--apiKey=YourApiKey]

			If you do not specify the namespace with --name, the folder name is used instead.
			If you do not specify an API key, modify the appsettings.json file. After this, build
			and run with:

			dotnet run

			This should provide some basic information about your Meraki account to demonstrate a
			working project.

			You should then inspect and modify the contents of Application.cs.

Parameters.Name: skipRestore
Parameters.Description: If specified, skips the automatic restore of the project on create.

Parameters.Name: apiKey
Parameters.Description: If specified, sets the Meraki API token in the appsettings.json file.

TemplatePackages.Name: Consoleable
TemplatePackages.Description:
A slightly-opinionated `dotnet new` template for a component classlib which also runs
from the commandline. The opinions are that logging, configuration and testing are good 
things, but should each be opt-in and should then work out of the box.

Usage:

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
dotnet new consoleable [--name MyName] [--xunit] [--nunit] [--sln] [--serilog] [--testbase] [--netstandard2]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
# --xunit : also generate a skeleton xunit test project for the new project
# --nunit : also generate a skeleton nunit test project for the new project
# --sln : also generate a solution file referencing the new project(s).
# --serilog : use Serilog for logging
# --testbase : add TestBase fluent assertions to your test project
# --net5 | --netstandard2 : generate projects with the given framework target instead of net6 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

https://github.com/chrisfcarroll/Consoleable

TemplatePackages.Name: Rundeck.Cli
TemplatePackages.Description:
Creates a template Rundeck project for .NET Core 3.1.

To install (or update) the template, type:

	dotnet new -i Rundeck.Cli

If you do not specify the namespace with --name, the folder name is used instead

Once installed, go to an empty folder and type:

	dotnet new rundeck [--name Project.Namespace] [--uri (API URI)] [--apiToken (API token)]

If you did NOT provide URI or apiToken at the command line,
edit the appsettings.json file to set your credentials.

After this, build and run with:

	dotnet run

This should provide some basic information about your Rundeck account to demonstrate a working project.

Parameters.Name: skipRestore
Parameters.Description: If specified, skips the automatic restore of the project on create.

Parameters.Name: uri
Parameters.Description: If specified, sets the Rundeck URL in the appsettings.json file.

Parameters.Name: apiToken
Parameters.Description: If specified, sets the Rundeck API token in the appsettings.json file.

profile.Description: Set a profile and region within `appsettings.json`

Parameters.Description: Set the AWS profile's region. see: https://medium.com/r/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcodewithmukesh.com%2Fblog%2Faws-credentials-for-dotnet-applications%2F

Parameters.Description: The target framework for the project.

Parameters.Description: Use prometheus exporter for Open Telemetry's metrics.

Parameters.Name: ExcludeLaunchSettings
Parameters.Description: Whether to exclude launchSettings.json in the generated template.

Parameters.Name: kestrelHttpPort
Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the HTTP endpoint in launchSettings.json.

Parameters.Name: kestrelHttpsPort
Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the HTTPS endpoint in launchSettings.json. This option is only applicable when the parameter no-https is not used (no-https will be ignored if either IndividualB2C or OrganizationalAuth is used).

Parameters.Name: iisHttpPort
Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the IIS Express HTTP endpoint in launchSettings.json.

Parameters.Name: iisHttpsPort
Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the IIS Express HTTPS endpoint in launchSettings.json. This option is only applicable when the parameter no-https is not used (no-https will be ignored if either IndividualB2C or OrganizationalAuth is used).

UsageExamples: dotnet new evtsrc -uri event-demo --consumer-group main-consumer -n MyCompany.Events -e MyEvent
dotnet new evtsrc -uri event-demo -s3 --aws-profile AWS_PROFILE --aws-profile-region us-east-1 --s3-bucket event-sourcing-demo --consumer-group main-consumer -n MyCompany.Events -e MyEvent
dotnet new evtsrc --no-producer -uri event-demo --consumer-group main-consumer -n MyCompany.Events -e MyEvent
dotnet new evtsrc --no-consumer -uri event-demo -n MyCompany.Events -e MyEvent
dotnet new evtsrc -uri event-demo --consumer-group main-consumer --github-ci --git-email ci-mail@gmail.com -n MyCompany.Events -e MyEvent

TemplatePackages.Name: BrandonAlexander.ProjectTemplates.WebApiJwt
TemplatePackages.Description: Standard Web API template with additional configuration option for JSON Web Token authentication.

Templates.Name: ASP.NET Core Web API w/ JWT
Templates.Author: Brandon Alexander
Templates.Description: Standard Web API template with additional configuration for JWT bearer token authentication.

Parameters.Name: auth
Parameters.Description: The type of authentication to use

IndividualB2C.Description: Individual authentication with Azure AD B2C

SingleOrg.Description: Organizational authentication for a single tenant

Parameters.Name: AAdB2CInstance
Parameters.Description: The Azure Active Directory B2C instance to connect to (use with IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: SignUpSignInPolicyId
Parameters.Description: The sign-in and sign-up policy ID for this project (use with IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: AADInstance
Parameters.Description: The Azure Active Directory instance to connect to (use with SingleOrg auth).

Parameters.Name: ClientId
Parameters.Description: The Client ID for this project (use with SingleOrg or IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: Domain
Parameters.Description: The domain for the directory tenant (use with SingleOrg or IndividualB2C auth).

Parameters.Name: DefaultScope
Parameters.Description: The API scope the client needs to request to provision an access token. (use with IndividualB2C, SingleOrg).

Parameters.Name: TenantId
Parameters.Description: The TenantId ID of the directory to connect to (use with SingleOrg auth).

Parameters.Name: OrgReadAccess
Parameters.Description: Whether or not to allow this application read access to the directory (only applies to SingleOrg auth).

Parameters.Name: UserSecretsId
Parameters.Description: The ID to use for secrets (use with OrgReadAccess or Individual auth).

Parameters.Name: ExcludeLaunchSettings
Parameters.Description: Whether to exclude launchSettings.json in the generated template.

Parameters.Name: HttpPort
Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the HTTP endpoint in launchSettings.json.

Parameters.Name: HttpsPort
Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the HTTPS endpoint in launchSettings.json. This option is only applicable when the parameter no-https is not used (no-https will be ignored if either IndividualAuth or OrganizationalAuth is used).

Parameters.Name: NoHttps
Parameters.Description: Whether to turn off HTTPS. This option only applies if Individual, IndividualB2C, SingleOrg, or MultiOrg aren't used for --auth.

Parameters.Name: UseLocalDB
Parameters.Description: Whether to use LocalDB instead of SQLite. This option only applies if --auth Individual or --auth IndividualB2C is specified.

Parameters.Name: Framework
Parameters.Description: The target framework for the project.

Parameters.Name: skipRestore
Parameters.Description: If specified, skips the automatic restore of the project on create.

Parameters.Name: CalledApiUrl
Parameters.Description: URL of the API to call from the web app. This option only applies if --auth SingleOrg or --auth IndividualB2C is specified.

Parameters.Name: CallsMicrosoftGraph
Parameters.Description: Specifies if the web app calls Microsoft Graph. This option only applies if --auth SingleOrg is specified.

Parameters.Name: CalledApiScopes
Parameters.Description: Scopes to request to call the API from the web app. This option only applies if --auth SingleOrg or --auth IndividualB2C is specified.

Templates.Name: Modern C# 11 .editorconfig

Templates.Description: Settings for C# 11 code formatting, style, naming style and analysis. Promotes conciseness, readability and leveraging the latest language features.

Templates.Name: Modern C# 11 multiservice pattern for Orleans 7
Templates.Author: VincentH.NET @ Applicita
Templates.Description: Solution for a single Microsoft Orleans 7 (micro)service containing one or more logical services

Parameters.Name: RootNamespace
Parameters.Description:
The prefix (without trailing .) for all project root namespaces in the solution.
Consider using <Company>.<Product|Technology>

Parameters.Name: Multiservice
Parameters.Description:
The name (without 'Service' suffix) of the multiservice
Consider using [<Product|Technology>]<Team name>
Used in the name of the solution and as suffix for Apis and Contracts assembly names
To add more logical services to an existing multiservice solution, use AddLogicalService.ps1 <name> (or specify --Multiservice .)

Parameters.Name: Logicalservice
Parameters.Description:
The name (without 'Service' suffix) of the logical service to add to the solution.
Used in the name of the new service project and in new namespaces + classes in the Apis and Contracts projects

Templates.Author: VincentH.NET @ Applicita

Parameters.Description: The target framework for the Solution.

Parameters.Name: Company
Parameters.Description: The company or author name for the application. If omitted, the company or author name will be not be included in the file header.

Parameters.Name: LicenseIdentifier
Parameters.Description: The Software Package Data Exchange (SPDX) license identifier for the solution. If "None" is selected, the license file will not be included in the solution and the license identifier will not be included in the file header.

Parameters.Name: AddIcon
Parameters.Description: Adds an icon to the project.

Parameters.Name: DatabaseProvider
Parameters.Description: The Entity Framework Core database provider.

Sqlite.Description: SQLite database provider for Entity Framework Core.

SqlServerExpress.Description: Microsoft SQL Server (Express) database provider for Entity Framework Core.

SqlServerLocalDB.Description: Microsoft SQL Server (LocalDB) database provider for Entity Framework Core.

Parameters.Name: Database
Parameters.Description: The name of the database for the application. If omitted, the solution name will be used.

Parameters.Name: DatabaseTable
Parameters.Description: The name of the initial table to create in the database. If omitted, the inital database table will be named TodoItem.

Parameters.Name: UseSerilog
Parameters.Description:
Adds NuGet package(s)
    Serilog.Enrichers.Environment
    Serilog.Enrichers.Process
    Serilog.Enrichers.Thread
    Serilog.Extensions.Hosting
    Serilog.Settings.Configuration
    Serilog.Sinks.Console
    Serilog.Sinks.Debug
    Serilog.Sinks.File

Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the IIS Express HTTP endpoint in launchSettings.json.

Parameters.Description: Port number to use for the IIS Express HTTPS endpoint in launchSettings.json.

Templates.Name: ASP.NET WAGI Web App
Templates.Author: Simon Davies
Templates.Description: Creates a new C# dotnet web app configured with the Deislabs wagi-dotnet extension. This enables the hosting of WAGI http endpoints in ASP.Net Core, if none of the optional parameters are set it will configure a demo endpoint with a simple fibonacci sequnce generator. The optional parameters enable hosting of custom WASM/WAGI modules, once the appplicatio has been created additional modules can be added in the json configuration file

Parameters.Name: path
Parameters.Description: This is the path under the server you want to expose your first WASM/WAGI handler at

Parameters.Name: filename
Parameters.Description: This is the filename of the wasm module that contains the WASM/WAGI handler, the server expects to find this in the modules directory (fibonacci.wasm is provided in the template), the module can either be a WASM (.wasm) or WAT (.wat) formatted file. If you provide a custom file name it will be copied to the correct location during installation

Parameters.Name: entrypoint
Parameters.Description: This is entrypoint in the module to expose, if the WAGI handler is not using the default endpoint configure the entrypoint name here.

Parameters.Name: environment
Parameters.Description: any environment variables to be set in the WASM/WAGI Modules environment in the form of  '"KEY1":"value1","KEY2":"value2"'.

Parameters.Name: volumes
Parameters.Description: any volumes to be mounted in the WASM/WAGI Modules environment in the form of '"hostpath1":"guestpath1","hostpath2":"guestpath2"'.

Parameters.Name: httpmethod
Parameters.Description: This is HTTP METHOD used for the module handler

Templates.Author: Aeroverra
Templates.Description: A template for creating a Stream Deck plugin for Mac / Windows using the Aerove Stream Deck Client.

Parameters.Name: Plugins Path
Parameters.Description: The path to your Stream Deck plugins folder

Parameters.Name: UUID
Parameters.Description: The unique identifier of the action. It must be a uniform type identifier (UTI) that contains only lowercase alphanumeric characters (a-z, 0-9), hyphen (-), and period (.). The string must be in reverse-DNS format. For example, if your domain is elgato.com and you create a plugin named Hello with the action My Action, you could assign the string com.elgato.hello.myaction as your action's Unique Identifier.

Parameters.Name: Author
Parameters.Description: The author of the plugin. This string is displayed to the user in the Stream Deck store.

Parameters.Name: Category
Parameters.Description: The name of the custom category in which the actions should be listed. This string is visible to the user in the actions list. If you don't provide a category, the actions will appear inside a 'Custom' category.

Parameters.Name: Description
Parameters.Description: Provides a general description of what the plugin does. This string is displayed to the user in the Stream Deck store.

Parameters.Name: Plugin Name
Parameters.Description: The name of the plugin. This string is displayed to the user in the Stream Deck store.

Parameters.Name: URL
Parameters.Description: A site to provide more information about the plugin.

TemplatePackages.Name: ReportMagic.Cli
TemplatePackages.Description:
Creates a template ReportMagic project for .NET 7.0.

			To install (or update) the template, type:

			dotnet new install ReportMagic.Cli

			Once installed, go to an empty folder and type:

			dotnet new reportmagic [--name Project.Namespace] [--apiTokenName=YourTokenName] [--apiTokenKey=YourTokenKey]

			If you do not specify the namespace with --name, the folder name is used instead.
			If you do not specify an API key, modify the appsettings.json file. After this, build
			and run with:

			dotnet run

			This should attempt to run the Report Schedule specified in appsettings.json.
			
			You should then inspect and modify the contents of Application.cs.

Parameters.Name: skipRestore
Parameters.Description: If specified, skips the automatic restore of the project on create.

Parameters.Name: apiTokenName
Parameters.Description: If specified, sets the ReportMagic API token name in the appsettings.json file.

Parameters.Name: apiTokenKey
Parameters.Description: If specified, sets the ReportMagic API token key in the appsettings.json file.

TemplatePackages.Name: EmptyWebContentProject.Template
TemplatePackages.Description:
Empty Web Project for static files that contains no code and can publish with WebDeploy. Uses a .NET Core project with without code and root site content publishing. This template does the following:
    

* Adds a `program.cs` with `void static Main()` function (required to build)
* Adds `<IsWebConfigTransformDisabled>True</IsWebConfigTransformDisabled>` to project
* Publishes all root folder files (you can customize include/exclude lists)
* Supports Publishing via WebDeploy to IIS out of the box
* Excludes binaries and project files
* Adds a default WebDeploy Publishing Profile

TemplatePackages.Name: Template.CleanArchitecture.CodeFirst
TemplatePackages.Description:
web api template with full example of code first and swagger versionning and Temporal table (Audit table), .net6
	How U Can Use It ?
	open visual studio code and run command 
	dotnet new --install Template.CleanArchitecure.CodeFirst
	then u can find template in visual studio 2022 templates
	or u can create your project by command    
	dotnet new Api.CodeFirst -o 'yourProjectName'
	If you need Enable swagger Versionning , you can use command 
	dotnet new api.codefirst -o 'yourProjectName' -E 'true'
	If you need Enable Temporal Table , you can use command 
	dotnet new api.codefirst -o 'yourProjectName' -A 'true'
